class.name: PathArea3D
class.brief_description: PathArea3D creates an area by duplicating the input shape along a [Path3D].
class.description: This node takes the input shape and duplicates it along a [Path3D] with specified parameters. It is meant to quickly create simple areas along a path. The shape can be transformed to be relative to the path node or local to the PathArea3D node.

method.name: queue_rebuild
method.description: Queues a rebuild of the area. This method is called automatically when the path or shape is changed.

members.member: Determines how to align the shapes along the path. See [enum Alignment] for more information.
When [member distribution] is set to [constant DISTRIBUTE_BY_COUNT], this value determines how many shapes will be created along the path.
When [member distribution] is set to [constant DISTRIBUTE_BY_DISTANCE], this value determines the distance between each shape along the path.
Determines how the shapes are distributed along the path. See [enum Distribution] for more information.
The path to duplicate the shape along.
Determines how the shapes will be transformed relative to this node or the path node. See [enum RelativeTransform] for more information.
Determines the rotation of the shape along the path.
Determines how the rotation is applied to the shape along the path. See [enum Rotation] for more information.
When true, the path will be sampled using cubic interpolation, which can provide smoother results for curved paths.
The collision shape resource to duplicate along the path.

signal.name: curve_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the path is changed.

signal.name: shape_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the shape is changed.
